title: Bootstrap Themes
synopsis: [[Bootstrap]] is a front end framework. Here we collect and review the ones we like best, with a view to creating templates for [[Fedwiki Splash Sites]] - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bootstrap_(front-end_framework) wikipedia]

title: Custom CSS
synopsis: You can set the [[CSS]] for individual wiki sites in a farm by adding a theme folder to the status folder of the site.

title: Dashboard Themes
synopsis: Here we collect curated lists of static site dashboards:

title: Design
synopsis: Design is the creation of a plan or convention for the construction of an object, system or measurable human interaction (as in architectural blueprints, engineering drawings, business processes, circuit diagrams, and sewing patterns). Design has different connotations in different fields (see design disciplines below). In some cases, the direct construction of an object (as in pottery, engineering, management, coding, and graphic design) is also considered to use design thinking - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Design wikipedia]

title: Event Themes
synopsis: Here we collect curated lists of static site event themes and templates:

title: Fedwiki Tools
synopsis: Here we list a few tools that are of particular use in managing and creating [[Fedwiki]] content.

title: Hugo Kube theme
synopsis: Kube is a professional and a responsive [[Hugo]] theme for developers and designers that offers a documentation section mixed with a landing page and a blog. The theme based on the Version 6.5.2 Kube Framework - [https://imperavi.com/kube/ imperavi.com]

title: Hugo Themes
synopsis: Here we collect [[Hugo]] themes that we can use in projects. You may also want to take a look at the curated list of [[Retro]] themed sites.

title: Minimal Hugo Themes
synopsis: Below are a collection of links imported from [[OneTab]]. You can view these links here - [https://www.one-tab.com/page/F1EXuRQnTQafcAmbgdrfug one-tab.com]:

title: Netlify
synopsis: Netlify can be used both from a web UI or by using command line tools. You can create unlimited domains with the free account. For $45 a month you get team sharing, administrator roles, visitor password control, and email and chat support.

title: Pretty Wiki
synopsis: Pretty wiki is a minimal rendering of wiki, without the wobble, or clutter of the journal. It is a deferential design of wiki that emphasises reading - a way to publish content from [http://livecode.world/pretty_wiki.html wiki]

title: Static Themes
synopsis: Here we collect curated lists of interesting static site themes and templates. You can find a wide range of pre-built themes on [https://themeforest.net/downloads themeforest.net]

title: Webflow
synopsis: Webflow is a hosted static site design solution that combines the ability to collaborate on pure modern HTML5 [[responsive web design]] with the ability to download the resultant CSS, HTML5 and Javascript for hosting on your own [[static site]]s.

title: Webflow templates
synopsis: Below are some example [[Webflow templates]] designed specifically for [[Webflow]]. There are not that many templates available - partly because it is so easy to create your own from any HtML5 standards based texplate - but you can find some on [https://themeforest.net/category/cms-themes/webflow themeforest.net]

title: Welcome Visitors

synopsis: Here we work on the relationship between [[Hugo]] and [[FedWiki]].
